channel.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
channel.description:
http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/nov/28/us-embassy-cable-leak-diplomacy-crisis
This truly is Christmas Eve! Discuss.

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

IIRC a warrant for Assange’s arrest was sent out today… on rape charges

Yeah, the government didn’t like being fucked in the ass.

(By the way, he is NOT being charged with rape, that’s a bullshit smear tactic. He’s being charged with a sex offense that is not an offense in any sane country. Go look it up, its pretty lulz.)

Read full topic
item.source: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Frell:

IIRC a warrant for Assange’s arrest was sent out today… on rape charges in Sweden?

Peculiar to say the least.

cooper:

Some of the reactions to this are ridiculous… political figures outright saying he should be assassinated!

It’s pretty odd that most governments condemn WikiLeaks instead of the diplomats in their country. I saw that stupid Canadian retard that said he wanted to see Assange assassinated. What a fuckwit.

Read full topic

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:370919”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=467010.msg3415496#msg3415496 date=1291020149]
So Hillary Clinton ordering Diplomats to spy on the UN isn’t anything of value?
[/quote]

No. All diplomats should keep a close eye on whats going on at the UN, and report back to their country, shouldn’t they? That is all ‘spying’ would entail, unless there is some wire tapping or something else I’m not aware of going on.[/quote]She has told diplomats to get passwords and encryption keys as well as information about the UN IT-Infrastructure.

Not only that, but she also told diplomats in other countries to get fingerprints, credit card numbers and DNA samples of country hotshots.

Read full topic

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:370919”]First of all, don’t know what ‘cables’ are. We only use that word to refer to wires that transmit or support something (such as ethernet cables, or air-craft cables). I inferred they are communications, but that is odd.

And secondly, of the things on the guardian website, I thought all of that was already public knowledge. Of course other arab countries want us to do their dirty work and bomb iran, of course pakistan’s nuclear inventory is a disaster waiting to happen, of course the russian mob runs russia. Oooh, big leaks Also, quite a bit of it is about other countries, like something about england’s prince that no one cares about.

In short, so what? :)[/quote]
Exactly my point, i see nothing of value leaked at all, and nothing major i didn’t already know.

Read full topic
item.source: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I think it’s great that while certain governments have been plotting the fate of people in secrecy, organizations like wikileaks are exposing them for the scum that they really are. I am not talking about the US.

This is from a meeting with US and Yemeni officials:

President Obama has approved providing U.S.
intelligence in support of ROYG ground operations against
AQAP targets, General Petraeus informed Saleh. Saleh reacted
coolly, however, to the General’s proposal to place USG
personnel inside the area of operations armed with real-time,
direct feed intelligence from U.S. ISR platforms overhead.
“You cannot enter the operations area and you must stay in
the joint operations center,” Saleh responded. Any U.S.
casualties in strikes against AQAP would harm future efforts,
Saleh asserted. Saleh did not have any objection, however,
to General Petraeus’ proposal to move away from the use of
cruise missiles and instead have U.S. fixed-wing bombers
circle outside Yemeni territory, “out of sight,” and engage
AQAP targets when actionable intelligence became available.
Saleh lamented the use of cruise missiles that are “not very
accurate” and welcomed the use of aircraft-deployed
precision-guided bombs instead. “We’ll continue saying the
bombs are ours, not yours,” Saleh said, prompting Deputy
Prime Minister Alimi to joke that he had just “lied” by
telling Parliament that the bombs in Arhab, Abyan, and Shebwa
were American-made but deployed by the ROYG.

How disgusted would you feel if such a person was running your country? How grateful would you feel if an organization like wikileaks exposed them for who they really are?

Read full topic
item.source: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)

item.title: The US fucks up again (surprise surprise!)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

First of all, don’t know what ‘cables’ are. We only use that word to refer to wires that transmit or support something (such as ethernet cables, or air-craft cables). I inferred they are communications, but that is odd.

And secondly, of the things on the guardian website, I thought all of that was already public knowledge. Of course other arab countries want us to do their dirty work and bomb iran, of course pakistan’s nuclear inventory is a disaster waiting to happen, of course the russian mob runs russia. Oooh, big leaks Also, quite a bit of it is about other countries, like something about england’s prince that no one cares about.

In short, so what?

Read full topic

item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

edit: Nvm just really slow[/quote]

I don’t think you’ll find them on the website. As far as I know, Wikileaks only released the new docs to news agencies.

Certain middle-eastern countries have (secretly I assume) been calling for the US to attack Iran, it must be really awkward for them right now.
